IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE MISSION OF THE AMERICAN DENTAL EDUCATION ASSOCIATION IS TO LEAD INDIVIDUALS AND INSTITUTIONS OF THE DENTAL EDUCATION COMMUNITY TO ADDRESS CONTEMPORARY ISSUES INFLUENCING EDUCATION, RESEARCH, AND THE DELIVERY OF ORAL HEALTH CARE FOR THE IMPROVEMENT OF THE HEALTH OF THE PUBLIC.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE MISSION OF THE AMERICAN DENTAL EDUCATION ASSOCIATION IS TO LEAD INDIVIDUALS AND INSTITUTIONS OF THE DENTAL EDUCATION COMMUNITY TO ADDRESS CONTEMPORARY ISSUES INFLUENCING EDUCATION, RESEARCH, AND THE DELIVERY OF ORAL HEALTH CARE FOR THE IMPROVEMENT OF THE HEALTH OF THE PUBLIC.
IRS990.Description: PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENTThe ADEA Office of Professional Development COORDINATES AND PROVIDES ALL LOGISTICAL SUPPORT AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND REVIEW FOR ALL MEETINGS, CONFERENCE AND WORKSHOPS SPONSORED BY THE ASSOCIATION. THE ASSOCIATION HOLDS OVER 50 MEETINGS A YEAR INCLUDING THE ANNUAL SESSION WHICH ATTRACTS OVER 2,000 DENTAL EDUCATORS.

Activity2.Description: Educational PathwaysAADSAS is available to all students applying to dental schools participating in the application service. AADSAS is a centralized application service sponsored by the Association and simplifies the application process by providing on standardized from, relieving students of the need to complete multiple applications. Dental programs benefit by receiving uniform information on all applicants. PASS is centralized application service for more then 500 participating postdoctoral dental education programs. PASS service is available to all individuals applying to postdoctoral dental education programs participating in the application service. PASS simplifies the application process by providing one standardized format.

Activity3.Description: Education, Policy, and ResearchThe ADEA Center for Education, Policy and Research conducts educational policy research and studies in areas relevant to the needs of dental education over the next 5 to 10 years. In addition, it stimulates discussion and recommends policies to ADEA leadership about significant issues affecting the relationships of dental education to higher education and to the oral health of the public. While strengthening the fundamental importance and responsibilities of a dental school within the academic community of a modern university and emphasize how its unique activities contribute to as well as benefit from the parent institution. The CEPR also guides the development of future leaders for dental education and higher education.

ActivityOther.Description: Public Policy and AdvocacyThe ADEA Center for Public Policy and Advocacy represents academic dental education institutions on Capitol Hill, affecting legislation that will shape the future of dental education. The mission of ADEA is to lead individuals and institutions of the dental education community in addressing contemporary issues influencing education, research, and the delivery of oral health care for the improvement of the health of the public.

Publications/Member ServicesThe Publications Function of the Division of Member Services focuses on publications, member services and public relations. Of critical importance is its role in publishing the scholarly journal, the Journal of Dental Education and membership news and events through the Bulletin of Dental Education.

Knowledge ManagementThe ADEA Division of Knowledge Management archives, repurposes and disseminates critical association data, information, and best practices in support of the strategic goals of the organization.

Equity and DiversityThe ADEA Center for Equity and Diversity (CED) supports the advancement of women and minority initiatives, access, diversity , and related activities of the association. CED's objectives are to (1) promote the advancement of women and minorities in dental education; (2) endeavor to improve recruitment and retention of underrepresented minorities at academic dental institutions; (3) promote the value of diversity in health policy development adn advocacy and; (4) foster alliances and leverage resources to promote and sustain diversity initiatives.
MembershipThe ADEA Division of Member Services focuses on publications, member services, and public relations.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Part X, line 2 - ADEA is tax-exempt under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code (IRC), except for taxes on income unrelated to its exempt purpose. ADEAGies Foundation is exempt from federal income taxes under Section 501(c)(3) of the IRC and is a supporting organization of ADEA under Section 509(a)(3) of the IRC. The Association has adopted the guidance in the income tax standard regarding the recognition and measurement of uncertain tax positions. The adoption of this standard had no impact on the Association's financial statements. The Association files as a tax-exempt organization. Should that status be challenged in the future, the Association's 2007, 2008 and 2009 tax years are open for examination by the IRS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Grantees are required to obtain approval for activities and expenses from ADEA's staff liaison, provide evidence of expenses incurred or report to ADEA's staff liaison on their activities, as required by the terms of the individual grant.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Individual, Corporate and institutional dues paying members.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ADEA's members elect the governing body.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The governing body's decisions are subject to approval by members.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Form 990 is distributed to the Board of Directors Finance Committee for the review and comments. All comments are addressed before final copy is filed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ADEA Employees, Officers, Directors and Trustees are required to disclose annually any potential conflicts of interest. Any conflicts that come to the attention of the Board of Directors are discussed and resolved according to the Organization's bylaws.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board approves salary increases on an annual basis for staff based on the market data numbers from the Bureau of Labor Statistics CPI and CPU inflation data. Additionally, every two years ADEA undergoes a compensation structure review process completed by an outside organization to ensure there is internal and external equity regarding the pay ADEA employees receive. During this process ADEA positions are benchmarked against the external market data using published salary surveys.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ADEA makes its governing documents, financial statements and policies available to the public upon request.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: The organization has a Finance Committee that oversees this responsibility.
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The process has not changed from the prior year.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: Dental Education, Research, Leadership and Recognition
